data.title: Massive improvemnts to shadows quality/flexibility
data.body: Significant changes to how PCF shadows work, made them took less samples with higher quality results, also added more flexible control of the filtering radius in the editor.

data.title: Viewport size_changed emitted before viewport transform updated on window maximize
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Happening on version 2.1.1 Steam, Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have a custom Node2D where I draw a grid within _draw using draw_line.
To optimize I limit the drawing of the grid to the visible area.
To do so, I use get_viewport_rect() and get_viewport_transform().get_origin() to get the view rect.
To update the grid when the window is being resized I have connected the size_changed signal to the update function.
Unfortunately when I click the maximize window button, get_viewport_rect() gives and updated value but not get_viewport_transform().get_origin().
Strangely, if I resize the window manually, then both values are updated.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a custom Node2D
2.  Create a _draw function like this:
```gdscript
func _draw():
	var clip = get_viewport_rect()
	var origin = get_viewport_transform().get_origin()
	print("Origin: :", origin)
	var pos = clip.pos - origin
	var end = clip.end - origin
	
	# Vertical lines
	for x in range(pos.x, end.x):
		if(x == 0):
			draw_line(Vector2(x, pos.y), Vector2(x, end.y), Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.5))
		elif(x % 40 == 0):
			draw_line(Vector2(x, pos.y), Vector2(x, end.y), Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.25))
	
	# Horizontal lines
	for y in range(pos.y, end.y):
		if(y == 0):
			draw_line(Vector2(pos.x, y), Vector2(end.x, y), Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.5))
		elif(y % 40 == 0):
			draw_line(Vector2(pos.x, y), Vector2(end.x, y), Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.25))
```
3. Maximize the window
4. The grid does not fill the entire window

data.title: AssetLib recognise already installed
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 25 x86_64 - Godot Engine v2.1.1.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In AssetLib tab, there is no indication of any kind that an entry is already installed.
You can still download it (again), and only when trying to install it, you see that all filenames in proposed installation are red, implying already existing files.

I think that there should be an indication that either:
- latest version of addon is already installed or
- addon is installed but there is newer version avaliable

If user already has latest version of addon, do still allow him to re-download the latest version again, but in that case change the button text from "Install" to "Reinstall"

data.title: Fix scroll bar moving in AnimationPlayer editor
Random Number Generation class
data.body:
I find Godot's random number generation methods to be somewhat lacking.
I think for a game engine, there should be more random number generation methods built-in.

It would be nice if Godot implemented something like this:
https://docs.python.org/2/library/random.html

I've never written Python but since GDScript is based on it, I looked up what rng features Python had, and it looks a lot better than what GDScript has.

What is needed is a class like that that can encapsulate random number generation from a specified seed. Right now what we have are methods that use a shared global seed - but in game dev, you need separate RNGs with separate seeds for things such as an RNG for randomly generating procedural worlds with a 'world seed', another RNG for particles and non-important stuff - etc.

I have tried using ```rand_seed``` ... but there is no documentation on what type it returns (it looks like an int) and no documentation on the possible range.

So again, it would be great if Godot could provide an easy to use and optimized RNG class in GDScript encapsulating a seed and exposing methods such as

_init(seed = -1) - allows initializing the seed upon construction, default value means random seed
rand() - returns float 0-1
randi(max)
randf(max)
randf_range(from, to)
randi_range(from, to)

and even other methods like Python provides such as

(using Python's names)
choice(array) - returns a random element in the array
sample(n, array) - returns new array with n elements randomed from input array
shuffle(array) - shuffle the array in place

etc.

I was about to build a class like this built on ```rand_seed```, but as noted, I don't even know what range the values can be. Also I'm not sure what algorithm is being used for it and how good it is.

data.title: Fix color selected with mouse scroll
Multiline method chaining and argument lists
data.body:
This is a bit of a minor feature request for GDScript.

To help mitigate really long lines, it would be nice if you could write method chains on multiple lines, rather than being forced to have it all go on a single line. An example of this could be the following:

```
# go from this
block_size = get_node("Block").get_texture().get_size()

# to this
block_size = get_node("Block")
	.get_texture()
	.get_size()
```

Note the use of an indentation level to indicate that the chain belongs to the line above.

Doing this would let you write a really long method chain (if needed) without needing intermediate variables to store parts of the chain.

As the title suggests, this could also be useful in things like argument lists:

```
# going from this
Rect2((block_size + 255) / 2, door_width)

# to something like this
Rect2 (
	(block_size + 255) / 2,
	door_width )
```

This way if you're working with a super long argument list, you can break it up onto multiple lines to give a better overview.

Having to scroll sideways to be able to read the code isn't always super ideal, and not everyone has ultrawide monitors to work on, so this kind of breaking the code apart would be a nice addition.

data.title: Expose double linked list to script
data.body:
There is a double linked list in godots source code (*core/list.h*).
It would be nice if that would be exposed as there are some cases where a double linked list performs way better as a vector based.
Especially when it comes to inserting/removing elements at any position except the end.

I could do some work on this, but am not sure how to handle locking and registering it (Although i could try to mirror the behavior of the Array class).
Basically exposing the list<Variant*> and list<Variant*>::Element should do the trick i guess .?
Implementing it as iterable should also work similar to how Array does it.

Additionally (and if requested i could open another issue for this) exposing the core/ring_buffer.h as queue would also be nice for queue needs.
It should perform better as a queue using a double linked list (and def. better as a vector based list) with the limitation that it has a "fixed" size and potential allocates unused memory ofc.
But there are cases where exactly this behavior is needed.

data.body:

With overlapping obstacle polygons, Navigation2D finds an invalid path that crosses through polygons.
Which leads to characters trying to walk through walls.

data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10. Godot 2.2 Alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have a borderless game window, and when I switch to fullscreen and back (via `OS.set_window_fullscreen(flag)`), the window seems to get its borders back. And I cannot seem to get rid of them even though I call `OS.set_borderless_window(true`) again.

data.title: Copy-paste on Mac script editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

OS X 10.9.5, Godot 2.1.1 built from that git tag

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Copy-paste is not working. Can't get clipboard to work in script editor at all, and not between other applications and the script editor either. Cut deletes text, but also fails to update clipboard.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. copy (or cut) (from within script editor or in another application)
2. paste in script editor

Does not matter if using keyboard shortcuts or menu or right-click context menu.

I have the same version compiled on my Linux computer and it works fine to copy-paste there. Also never used Godot much in any previous version so I have no idea if this is something new or not but I find no existing issue.

data.title: Spinbox value is changed when it should not be.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.2 alpha

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
`Spinbox` value is changed while scrolling in `ScrollContainer` with mouse wheel even it's not focused.
It's changed also with mouse wheel and up/down button even it's disabled.

I would expect mouse wheel event should stop spread when spinbox is focused and mouse is inside of Spinbox.
And should not changed when it's not focused and disabled.

Xubuntu Linux, Latest 2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I try to use Input Map to register numeral keys with Slovak Keyboard layout, it doesn't register them as it types character "+         " and not the numbers, and if I use shift, it registers the whole shift+number. I can register them by switching to english keyboard but then when I switch back to Slovak, the buttons don't work in-game.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use Slovak Keyboard layout and see yourself.

data.title: Set minimum version to 10.9 building OSX
data.body:
Since XCode 6 Apple has only supplied the latest SDK with a macro switch to support earlier versions of the OS. Without the switch the minimum supported OS seems to match the latest SDK supplied with XCode.

Ergo, compiling using XCode 6 sets the minimum to 10.9, XCode 7 to 10.11 and XCode 8 to 10.12
2.1.1 having been compiled using XCode 7 won't run on anything older then 10.11 and for those of us who had to go to XCode 8 to deploy on the latest iOS.....

This pull request sets this minimum to 10.9 resulting in the binary produced being able to run on 10.9 upwards even when compiled with XCode 8

We'll need to monitor what the earliest SDK should be, Apple isn't shy in deprecating and then removing APIs nor introducing new APIs that replace old ones so going too far back may result in breaking the build on newer platforms.

data.title: UI-Elements aren't accessible due to big menu.
data.body:
Arch-Linux 64-Bit, Godot v.2.1.stable (xfce-desktop if it matters) resolution: 1366x768

I have an isssue that bothers me for quite a while now. If the menu over the editor gets to big the whole UI stretches even if there isn't enough space on the screen, resulting in inaccessibility of the panes on the right (Where usually the Inspector resides). I am also not able to resize the editor space in the left direction. To get to see the Inspector again I need to click on something that makes the menu smaller and afterwards let the window redraw (by making it small and big again). It's a hassle.

I have an image that shows the issue (this is my fullscreen, as you can see the right side is not visible)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12082018/20577371/3f8472a4-b1c2-11e6-9543-2a2d86fbdf79.png)

To reproduce this you just have click on a tilemap on small screen.

It would be nice if there would be some solution for the menu do go in an expander if there are to many items (or like it was done for tabs).

Thanks in advance.
